Award.AwardTitle: Cincinnati Symposium on Probability Theory and Applications 2018
Award.AbstractNarration:
The Cincinnati Symposium on Probability Theory and Applications 2018 will be held November 9 to 11, 2018 at the University of Cincinnati. The symposium will bring together junior and senior researchers working at the forefront of random matrix theory and stochastic processes. Results from these fields are increasingly used throughout the sciences and other areas of mathematics with direct applications including finance, insurance, statistics, number theory, and combinatorics. By connecting a broad array of researchers at different career stages with expertise in a variety of innovative techniques, the symposium will help foster the development of the mathematical theory of these fields. Professional development of the next generation of probabilists is a major focus of the symposium by providing early-stage researchers opportunities to present their work in talks and a poster session.

Recently developed techniques in random matrix theory and stochastic processes have led to many significant advances. As the scope of these fields expands, further progress is increasingly dependent on the combination of ideas from multiple areas. In order to break down barriers between researchers working with different tools and to foster new collaborations at the frontiers of these fields, the symposium will bring together experts working in several related areas. Topics from random matrix theory will include universal probability distributions, martingale techniques, and integrable probability, while those from stochastic processes will include Brownian excursions and combinatorial stochastic processes, stochastic partial differential equations, and infinitely-divisible processes. By connecting junior and senior probabilists using different methods, the symposium will help build bridges between areas and stimulate new cross-disciplinary investigations.

Symposium website: http://homepages.uc.edu/~buckinrt/cinciprob2018/

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Cincinnati Symposium on Probability Theory and Applications 2018 was held November 9-11, 2018 on the campus of the University of Cincinnati.  The symposium continued a successful series of conferences most recently held in 2014 and 2009.

The 2018 symposium focused on random matrix theory and stochastic processes, two rapidly developing and interrelated fields with applications including operations research, population genetics, finance, signal processing, wireless communications, nuclear physics, statistics, and number theory.  Recent years have seen significant mathematical advances in random matrix theory and stochastic processes using a variety of different methods, such as martingale theory and integrable probability.  The symposium intentionally brought together leading probabilists from different communities who are working on similar problems in order to encourage the exchange of ideas and the development of  new techniques.  Invited speakers included experts on stochastic PDEs, weakly dependent random variables, interacting particle systems, Levy processes, and infinitely divisible processes.

Another major goal of the symposium was to foster the professional development of the next generation of probabilists by providing junior mathematicians with opportunities to learn about the current state of the field, make professional connections, and share their own results.  A successful poster session was held with 17 participants presenting posters. A total of 27 graduate students and 4 postdocs participated in the Symposium, with 16 graduate students and 3 postdocs receiving travel support from funds provided by NSF.  Overall, the conference featured 14 speakers and 60 total participants from 6 countries and 33 different institutions.
